slides.title: Archery Game
slides.text: In this archery game, the player must shoot arrows past blocks to hit apples.
slides.foot: The complete game can be played on the Scratch website.

slides.title: Make the Cat Look Like Robin Hood
slides.text: Click the blue-white (i) button and rename Sprite1 to Cat.

slides.title: Make the Cat Look Like Robin Hood
slides.text: On the Costumes tab, click the "Convert to bitmap" button.

slides.title: Make the Cat Look Like Robin Hood
slides.text: Draw a green Robin Hood hat with red feather on the cat.

slides.title: Make the Cat Look Like Robin Hood
slides.text: Draw a bow in the cat's hand.

slides.title: Program the W and S Keys to Move the Cat Up and Down
slides.text: On the Scripts tab, add the following code to Cat: when green flag> clicked forever

slides.title: Program the W and S Keys to Move the Cat Up and Down
slides.text: Add the following code to Cat: if <key w pressed> then

slides.title: Program the W and S Keys to Move the Cat Up and Down
slides.text: Add the following code to Cat: change y by 10

slides.title: Program the W and S Keys to Move the Cat Up and Down
slides.text: Add the following code to Cat: if <key s pressed> then

slides.title: Program the W and S Keys to Move the Cat Up and Down
slides.text: Add the following code to Cat: change y by -10

slides.title: Program the W and S Keys to Move the Cat Up and Down
slides.text: Move the cat to the left side of the Stage.

slides.title: Test #1
slides.text:
Click on File > Save. Then test to make sure your program has the following:
  • Click the green flag and press the W and S keys to move the Cat up and down.
If the program doesn't do all of these things, check the previous steps to make sure you copied the code exactly. If you still can't figure it out, ask for help.

slides.title: Draw the Arrow
slides.text: Draw the arrow with a light gray arrow head. MAKE SURE THE ARROW HEAD IS ON THE CROSSHAIRS IN MIDDLE OF THE PAINT EDITOR.

slides.title: Draw the Arrow
slides.text: Rename the arrow sprite to "Arrow".

slides.title: Draw the Arrow
slides.text: Add the following code. Try different sizes for the arrow until you find a good size. Your size might not be 100: when green flag> clicked set size to 50%

slides.title: Create Variables
slides.text: Create variables for the "Score" and "arrow is ready".

slides.title: Create Variables
slides.text: Add this code to the Arrow sprite: set arrow is ready to yes set Score to 0

slides.title: Add Code to Shoot Arrow
slides.text: Add the following code to the Cat sprite: when space key pressed if then

slides.title: Add Code to Shoot Arrow
slides.text: Add the following code to the Cat sprite: arrow is ready = yes

slides.title: Add Code to Shoot Arrow
slides.text: Add the following code to the Cat sprite: create clone of Arrow

slides.title: Add Code to Shoot Arrow
slides.text: Add the following code to the Arrow sprite: when I start as a clone

slides.title: Add Code to Shoot Arrow
slides.text: Add the following code to the Arrow sprite: set arrow is ready to no go to Cat

slides.title: Add Code to Shoot Arrow
slides.text: Add the following code to the Arrow sprite:point towards mouse-pointer move 30 steps

slides.title: Add Code to Shoot Arrow
slides.text: Add the following code to the Arrow sprite: show forever

slides.title: Add Code to Shoot Arrow
slides.text: Add the following code to the Arrow sprite: move 25 steps

slides.title: Test #2
slides.text:
Click on File > Save. Then test to make sure your program has the following:
  • Click the green flag and press space to shoot an arrow. Note that at this point you can only shoot once.
If the program doesn't do all of these things, check the previous steps to make sure you copied the code exactly. If you still can't figure it out, ask for help.

slides.title: Add Code to Shoot Arrow
slides.text: Add the following code to the Arrow sprite: hide

slides.title: Add the Purple Blocks That Float Up
slides.text: Click the Face button and select Button3.

slides.title: Add the Purple Blocks That Float Up
slides.text: Click the Costumes tab, and use the Fill tool to make the block purple.

slides.title: Add the Purple Blocks That Float Up
slides.text: Add the following code to the Button3 sprite: when green flag clicked set size to 50%

slides.title: Add the Purple Blocks That Float Up
slides.text: Add the following code to the Button3 sprite: go to x: 100 y: -180

slides.title: Add the Purple Blocks That Float Up
slides.text: Add the following code to the Button3 sprite forever create clone of myself

slides.title: Add the Purple Blocks That Float Up
slides.text: Add the following code to the Button3 sprite: wait (pick random 0.8 to 2) secs

slides.title: Add the Purple Blocks That Float Up
slides.text: Add the following code to the Button3 sprite: when I start as a clone show

slides.title: Add the Purple Blocks That Float Up
slides.text: Add the following code to the Button3 sprite: repeat until [ ] > [ ]

slides.title: Add the Purple Blocks That Float Up
slides.text: Add the following code to the Button3 sprite: y position > 170

slides.title: Add the Purple Blocks That Float Up
slides.text: Add the following code to the Button3 sprite: change y by 4 delete this clone

slides.title: Test #3
slides.text:
Click on File > Save. Then test to make sure your program has the following:
  • Click the Green Flag and watch the blocks move up.
If the program doesn't do all of these things, check the previous steps to make sure you copied the code exactly. If you still can't figure it out, ask for help.

slides.title: Add the Purple Blocks That Float Up
slides.text: Add the following code to the Button3 sprite: hide

slides.title: Make the Apples Float Down
slides.text: Click the face button and select Apple.

slides.title: Make the Apples Float Down
slides.text: Add the following code to the Apple sprite: when green flag clicked go to x: 200 y: 180

slides.title: Make the Apples Float Down
slides.text: Add the following code to the Apple sprite: forever create clone of myself

slides.title: Make the Apples Float Down
slides.text: Add the following code to the Apple sprite: wait (pick random 0.6 to 2) secs

slides.title: Make the Apples Float Down
slides.text: Add the following code to the Apple sprite: when I start as a clone show

slides.title: Make the Apples Float Down
slides.text: Add the following code to the Apple sprite: repeat until [ ] < [ ]

slides.title: Make the Apples Float Down
slides.text: Add the following code to the Apple sprite: y position < -170

slides.title: Make the Apples Float Down
slides.text: Add the following code to the Apple sprite: change y by -4 delete this clone

slides.title: Test #4
slides.text:
Click on File > Save. Then test to make sure your program has the following:
  • Click the Green Flag and watch the apples float down.
If the program doesn't do all of these things, check the previous steps to make sure you copied the code exactly. If you still can't figure it out, ask for help.

slides.title: Make the Apples Float Down
slides.text: Add the following code to the Apple sprite: hide

slides.title: Make the Arrows Bounce Off the Blocks
slides.text: Add the following code to the Arrow sprite: if then

slides.title: Make the Arrows Bounce Off the Blocks
slides.text: Add the following code to the Arrow sprite: color [ ] is touching [ ]?

slides.title: Make the Arrows Bounce Off the Blocks
slides.text: Click the left color box, then the grey arrow head, then the right color box, then the purple block.

slides.title: Make the Arrows Bounce Off the Blocks
slides.text: Add the following code to the Arrow sprite: repeat 10 turn counterclockwise 35 move 25 steps

slides.title: Make the Arrows Bounce Off the Blocks
slides.text: Add the following code to the Arrow sprite: set arrow is ready to yes delete this clone

slides.title: Test #5
slides.text:
Click on File > Save. Then test to make sure your program has the following:
  • Click the Green Flag and fire arrows at the purple blocks. Make sure they bounce off.
If the program doesn't do all of these things, check the previous steps to make sure you copied the code exactly. If you still can't figure it out, ask for help.

slides.title: Make the Arrows Hit the Apples
slides.text: Add the following code to the Arrow sprite: if color [ ] is touching [ ]? then

slides.title: Make the Arrows Hit the Apples
slides.text: Click the left color box, then the grey arrow head, then the right color box, then the red apple.

slides.title: Make the Arrows Hit the Apples
slides.text: Add the following code to the Arrow sprite: change Score by 1 set arrow is ready to yes

slides.title: Make the Arrows Hit the Apples
slides.text: Add the following code to the Arrow sprite: repeat until [ ] < [ ]

slides.title: Make the Arrows Hit the Apples
slides.text: Add the following code to the Arrow sprite: y position < -170

slides.title: Make the Arrows Hit the Apples
slides.text: Add the following code to the Arrow sprite: change y by -4 delete this clone

slides.title: Test #6
slides.text:
Click on File > Save. Then test to make sure your program has the following:
  • Click the Green Flag and shoot arrows at the apples. Make sure they stick into the apples.
If the program doesn't do all of these things, check the previous steps to make sure you copied the code exactly. If you still can't figure it out, ask for help.

slides.title: Make the Arrows Disappear If You Miss
slides.text: Add the following code to the Arrow sprite: if [ ] > [ ]

slides.title: Make the Arrows Disappear If You Miss
slides.text: Add the following code to the Arrow sprite: x position > 230

slides.title: Make the Arrows Disappear If You Miss
slides.text: Add the following code to the Arrow sprite: set arrow is ready to yes delete this clone

slides.title: Test #7
slides.text:
Click on File > Save. Then test to make sure your program has the following:
  • Click the Green Flag and make sure the arrows disappear if they reach the right edge of the stage.
If the program doesn't do all of these things, check the previous steps to make sure you copied the code exactly. If you still can't figure it out, ask for help.

slides.title: Congratulations! You're done!
slides.text: You did it! Now share your project so other people can see it and learn from its code!
